repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: There doesn't seem to be a reason why this module isn't included.

comment_data.body: I'm not sure this makes sense since there isn't a `vim/json.lua` module.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,6 +14,7 @@ vim.func = require('vim.func')
 vim.health = require('vim.health')
 vim.highlight = require('vim.highlight')
 vim.iter = require('vim.iter')
+vim.json = require('vim.json')

comment_data.body: Hmm did it not work in the meta file?
It generates a documentation entry for `vim.json.json`
But this doesn't work either lol

Lol you keep getting scalded by our _top quality_ doc generation.

For now you could try adding `--- @nodoc` above . That might work.
Yeah _someone_ should really rewrite the doc generator.
Better move this to the top of the file.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -34,3 +34,6 @@ function vim.json.decode(str, opts) end
 ---@param obj any
 ---@return string
 function vim.json.encode(obj) end
+
+---@nodoc
+vim.json = {}

comment_regular_data.body:
Ah actually there was a reason.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/runtime/lua/vim/_meta/json.lua

Defines the functions as `vim.*` so I don't think this is needed.

Are you getting warnings form LuaLs?
@lewis6991 no warnings but `vim.json` isn't offered as an LSP completion entry (although `encode` and `decode` do show up after typing `vim.json`)...

Ok sounds like a LuaLS quirk. We can probably trick it to do the right thing but I think the RHS of `require('vim.json')` isn't correct.

Might need to just add `vim.json = {}` in a meta file or something.

> So I assume this works?

Yep :)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(meta): make vim.json show up in LSP completions
